department: College of Computing and Digital Media
biography: Mary Jane Duffy has been teaching Fine Art, Foundations and First Year Program courses at DePaul since 1997.  She holds an MFA in painting and drawing from Northwestern University.  She has exhibited her work in numerous group shows in the U.S. and Mexico, including ?Color Key? at The Painting Center in New York,  ?Pigment? at Flatfile Galleries in Chicago, and ?Of Land and Water? at the Noyes Art Center.  Recent one-person exhibitions include ?Shimmer/Shine? at Flatfile Galleries and ?Light Bright? at Swell ArtSpace. While primarily a painter, her work is influenced by and utilizes digital technologies.
